summary:
Quakers are members of the Religious Society of Friends, a Christian group. They believe in a direct connection with God and follow the teachings of Jesus Christ. Quakers avoid creeds and hierarchical structures. They are known for their peaceful principles, refusing to participate in war or swear oaths.

Historically, Quakers were active in social justice, opposing slavery, and promoting peace. They've made significant contributions to banking, manufacturing, and philanthropy. In 1947, Quakers received the Nobel Peace Prize for their peace efforts.
title: Quakers
